Name: Strawberries Romanov (La Madeleine copycat)
RecipeIngredients:
1 lb of Strawberries
1 cup of whipping cream
2 tablespoons of powered sugar
3 ounces of Brandy
Comments: This is better with more Brandy.
Instructions:
1. Wash Strawberries and cut the tops off.
2. Let Strawberries drain.
3. Mix together heavy whipping cream, powdered sugar, and the brandy.
4. Beat with a mixer till this becomes thick.
5. Place Strawberries into glasses and spoon over the sauce.

Name: Pico de Gallo
RecipeIngredients:
6 small tomatoes diced into small pieces (4 medium or 3 large)
1 medium sweet onion diced into small pieces
3 stalks of green onion sliced thin
3 cloves of garlic minced
1 handful of Cilantro cut up into small pieces
2 to 3 medium sized Serrano Chili’s minced
Juice from 1 lemon or lime
Sea Salt to taste
1 avocado diced if desired (will cool down the heat)
Instructions:
1. In large mixing bowl combine all ingredients and mix until well blended.
2. Chili for at least 60 minutes prior to serving.

Great as a garnish for Mexican food or for use as a dip with tortilla chips.

Name: Mexican Rice
RecipeIngredients:
2 cups extra long grain white rice
2 knorr bouillion cubes – use flavor that will go with main dish
4 cups of water
1 teaspoon cumin
4 ounces of tomato sauce
2 tablespoons of butter or margarine
Instructions:
1. In a large skillet that has a lid.
2. Melt the butter or margarine and then add rice.
3. Cook the rice until it starts to turn brown.
4. Add Cumin and tomato sauce and mix together.
5. Add bouillion and water and stir to combine.
6. Bring mixture to a boil stirring constantly.
7. Reduce heat to low and cover.
8. Let cook until rice is tender and cooked.

Name: Chicken Enchiladas
RecipeIngredients:
1 ½ to 2 dozen Corn Tortillas
4 Chicken Breasts
1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
2 bay leaves
1 cup white onions, diced
1 small can sliced or chopped black olives
1 small can diced green chili’s
4 cups shredded Cheddar Cheese
1 – 15 oz can tomato sauce
1 – 8 oz can tomato sauce
6 tablespoons of Chili powder
2 cloves garlic
Salt and Pepper
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. Clean Chicken and pat dry.
3. Sprinkle the poultry seasoning into along with the bay leaves into a large pot of water and add Chicken.
4. Par Boil Chicken for at least 30 minutes or until the Chicken is cooked through.
5. Drain water and set aside to cool.
6. In a sauce pan add tomato sauce, chili powder and garlic.
7. Cook over medium heat and stir until mixture becomes bubbly.
8. Remove from heat placing a thin layer of sauce at the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish.
9. Set remainder aside for later.
10. Once the chicken has cooled shred it up and add onions, black olives, green chili’s, ½ the cheddar cheese and salt and pepper.
11. To soften corn tortillas, place tortilla in frying pay and turn over after about 15 seconds over medium heat.
12. Put about ¼ cup of the chicken mixture on tortilla and roll.
13. Place into a 9x13 inch baking pan.
14. Repeat until all of the chicken mixture is gone.
15. Take remaining sauce and pour over rolled chicken tortillas.
16. Sprinkle remaining cheddar cheese on top and cover with foil.
17. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Makes about 18 to 24 enchiladas.

Name: Strawberry Compote
RecipeIngredients:
2 cups ripe Strawberries
1 tablespoon fresh squeezed Lemon juice
½ cup granulated Sugar
½ teaspoon Lemon zest
1 teaspoon Cornstarch
Instructions:
1. Clean and chop up ripe Strawberries into 8 to 12 pieces each.
2. Add Strawberries, Sugar, and Lemon juice to a saucepan and mix over medium heat for 1 to 1.5 minutes.
3. Lower the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes mixing occasionally.
4. Mix the Cornstarch with a little bit of water in a small ramakin and then add to the sauce mixture continually stirring for 2 to 3 minutes.
5. Remove from heat and cool for 20 to 30 minutes.
6. Place finished compote into a storage container and store in refrigerator.
7. Once compote is cold it is ready for use.
